  7#ifndef vsip_core_stored_block_hpp_
  8#define vsip_core_stored_block_hpp_
  9
 10#include <vsip/support.hpp>
 11#include <vsip/domain.hpp>
 12#include <vsip/core/refcount.hpp>
 13#include <vsip/core/layout.hpp>
 14#include <vsip/core/dense_storage.hpp>
 15#include <vsip/core/user_storage.hpp>
 16#include <vsip/core/block_traits.hpp>
 17#include <vsip/core/parallel/local_map.hpp>
 18#include <stdexcept>
 19
 20namespace vsip
 21{
 22namespace impl
 23{
 24
 25/// Stored_block is a block-like type that stores its data
 26/// in (local) storage.
 27/// The default storage is Allocated_storage.
 28template <typename T, typename L>
 29class Stored_block : public Ref_count<Stored_block<T, L> >
 30{
 31  enum private_type {};
 32public:
 33  typedef T value_type;
 34  typedef T &reference_type;
 35  typedef T const &const_reference_type;
 36
 37  typedef typename Complex_value_type<T, private_type>::type uT;
 38
 39  typedef L layout_type;
 40  typedef Applied_layout<layout_type> applied_layout_type;
 41  typedef typename L::order_type order_type;
 42
 43  typedef Allocated_storage<typename L::complex_type, T> storage_type;
 44  typedef typename storage_type::type data_type;
 45  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_data_type;
 46
 47  typedef Local_map map_type;
 48
 49  static dimension_type const dim = L::dim;
 50
 51  Stored_block(Domain<dim> const &dom, map_type const &map = map_type())
 52    : layout_(dom),
 53      storage_(layout_.total_size()),
 54      map_(map)
 55  {}
 56
 57  Stored_block(Domain<dim> const &dom, T value, map_type const &map = map_type())
 58    : layout_(dom),
 59      storage_(layout_.total_size(), value),
 60      map_(map)
 61  {}
 62
 63  ~Stored_block() { storage_.deallocate(layout_.total_size());}
 64
 65  map_type const &map() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return map_;}
 66
 67  length_type size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
 68  {
 69    length_type retval = layout_.size(0);
 70    for (dimension_type d = 1; d < dim; ++d)
 71      retval *= layout_.size(d);
 72    return retval;
 73  }
 74
 75  length_type size(dimension_type block_dim, dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 76  {
 77    assert((block_dim == 1 || block_dim == dim) && (d < block_dim));
 78
 79    if (block_dim == 1) return size();
 80    else return layout_.size(d);
 81  }
 82
 83  value_type get(index_type idx) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 84  {
 85    assert(idx < size());
 86    return storage_.get(idx);
 87  }
 88  value_type get(index_type idx0, index_type idx1) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 89  {
 90    assert(idx0 < layout_.size(0) && idx1 < layout_.size(1));
 91    return storage_.get(layout_.index(idx0, idx1));
 92  }
 93  value_type get(index_type idx0, index_type idx1, index_type idx2) const VSIP_NOTHROW
 94  {
 95    assert(idx0 < layout_.size(0) && idx1 < layout_.size(1) &&
 96	   idx2 < layout_.size(2));
 97    return storage_.get(layout_.index(idx0, idx1, idx2));
 98  }
 99
100  void put(index_type idx, T val) VSIP_NOTHROW
101  {
102    assert(idx < size());
103    storage_.put(idx, val);
104  }
105  void put(index_type idx0, index_type idx1, T val) VSIP_NOTHROW
106  {
107    assert(idx0 < layout_.size(0) && idx1 < layout_.size(1));
108    storage_.put(layout_.index(idx0, idx1), val);
109  }
110  void put(index_type idx0, index_type idx1, index_type idx2, T val)
111    VSIP_NOTHROW
112  {
113    assert(idx0 < layout_.size(0) && idx1 < layout_.size(1) &&
114	   idx2 < layout_.size(2));
115    storage_.put(layout_.index(idx0, idx1, idx2), val);
116  }
117
118  data_type impl_data() { return storage_.data();}
119  const_data_type impl_data() const { return storage_.data();}
120  stride_type impl_stride(dimension_type block_dim, dimension_type d) const
121  {
122    assert(block_dim == 1 || block_dim == dim);
123    assert(d < dim);
124    if (block_dim == 1) return 1;
125    else return layout_.stride(d);
126  }
127
128private:
129  applied_layout_type layout_;
130  storage_type storage_;
131  map_type map_;
132};
133
134/// Stored_block specialization that stores its
135/// data in Dense_storage.
136template <dimension_type D, typename T, typename O, typename F>
137class Stored_block<T, Layout<D, O, Stride_unit_dense, F> >
138  : public Ref_count<Stored_block<T, Layout<D, O, Stride_unit_dense, F> > >
139{
140  enum private_type {};
141public:
142  typedef T value_type;
143  typedef T &reference_type;
144  typedef T const &const_reference_type;
145  typedef typename Complex_value_type<T, private_type>::type uT;
146
147  typedef F complex_type;
148
149  typedef Layout<D, O, Stride_unit_dense, F> layout_type;
150  typedef Applied_layout<layout_type> applied_layout_type;
151  typedef O order_type;
152
153  typedef Dense_storage<F, T> storage_type;
154  typedef typename storage_type::type data_type;
155  typedef typename storage_type::const_type const_data_type;
156
157  typedef Local_map map_type;
158
159  static dimension_type const dim = D;
160
161  Stored_block(Domain<dim> const &dom, map_type const &map = map_type())
162    : layout_(dom),
163      storage_(map.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size()),
164      map_(map),
165      admitted_(true)
166  {
167    map_.impl_apply(dom);
168  }
169
170  Stored_block(Domain<dim> const &dom, T value, map_type const &map = map_type())
171    : layout_(dom),
172      storage_(map.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size(), value),
173      map_(map),
174      admitted_(true)
175  {
176    map_.impl_apply(dom);
177  }
178
179  /// User-storage constructor.
180  ///
181  /// If user_data is compatible with the storage_ type
182  ///   (i.e. user_storage is array_format or interleaved_format and
183  ///   storage_ is Cmplx_inter_fmt, or
184  ///   user_storage is split_format and storage_ is Cmplx_split_fmt)
185  /// then storage_ will use the user provided storage,
186  /// else storage_ will allocate its own memory of the same size.
187  ///
188  /// On admit and release, storage_.is_alloc() is used to determine if
189  /// storage_ and user_data_ are the same (in which case no copy is
190  /// necessary to update), or different (copy necessary).
191  Stored_block(Domain<dim> const &dom,
192	       T *const pointer,
193	       map_type const &map = map_type())
194    : layout_(dom),
195      user_data_(array_format, pointer),
196      storage_(map.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size(),
197               user_data_.as_storage(complex_type())),
198      map_(map),
199      admitted_(false)
200  {
201  }
202
203  Stored_block(Domain<dim> const &dom,
204	       uT *const pointer,
205	       map_type const &map = map_type())
206    : layout_(dom),
207      user_data_(interleaved_format, pointer, 0),
208      storage_(map.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size(),
209	       user_data_.as_storage(complex_type())),
210      map_(map),
211      admitted_(false)
212  {
213  }
214
215  Stored_block(Domain<D> const &dom,
216	       uT *const real_pointer,
217	       uT *const imag_pointer,
218	       map_type const &map = map_type())
219    : layout_(dom),
220      user_data_(imag_pointer ? split_format : interleaved_format,
221		 real_pointer, imag_pointer),
222      storage_(map.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size(),
223	       user_data_.as_storage(complex_type())),
224      map_(map),
225      admitted_(false)
226  {
227  }
228
229  ~Stored_block() { storage_.deallocate(map_.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size());}
230
231  /// Rebind user-storage to a new array.
232  ///
233  /// Requires
234  ///   THIS must be a block with array_format user storage that is
235  ///      currently released.
236  void rebind(T* pointer)
237  {
238    assert(!admitted() && user_storage() == array_format);
239    user_data_.rebind(pointer);
240    storage_.rebind(map_.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size(),
241		    user_data_.as_storage(complex_type()));
242  }
243
244  /// Rebind user-storage to a new interleaved array.
245  ///
246  /// Requires
247  ///   THIS must be a block with interleaved_format or split_format
248  ///      user storage that is currently released.
249  ///
250  /// Note:
251  ///   When changing user storage from INTERLEAVED to ARRAY and
252  ///    vice-versa, a rebind() will allocate/deallocate memory.
253  void rebind(uT* pointer)
254  {
255    assert(!admitted() &&
256	   (user_storage() == split_format ||
257	    user_storage() == interleaved_format));
258    user_data_.rebind(pointer);
259    storage_.rebind(map_.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size(),
260		    user_data_.as_storage(complex_type()));
261  }
262
263  /// Rebind user-storage to new split arrays.
264  ///
265  /// Requires:
266  ///   THIS must be a block with interleaved_format or split_format
267  ///      user storage that is currently released.
268  ///
269  /// Note:
270  ///   When changing user storage from INTERLEAVED to ARRAY and
271  ///    vice-versa, a rebind() will allocate/deallocate memory.
272  void rebind(uT* real_pointer, uT* imag_pointer)
273  {
274    assert(!admitted() &&
275	   (user_storage() == split_format ||
276	    user_storage() == interleaved_format));
277    user_data_.rebind(real_pointer, imag_pointer);
278    storage_.rebind(map_.impl_pool(),
279		    layout_.total_size(),
280		    user_data_.as_storage(complex_type()));
281  }
282
283  // These three also resize the block.
284  void rebind(T *pointer, Domain<D> const &dom)
285  {
286    assert(!admitted() && user_storage() == array_format);
287    user_data_.rebind(pointer);
288    storage_.deallocate(map_.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size());
289    layout_ = applied_layout_type(dom);
290    storage_.rebind(map_.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size(),
291		    user_data_.as_storage(complex_type()));
292  }
293
294  void rebind(uT *pointer, Domain<D> const &dom)
295  {
296    assert(!admitted() &&
297	   (user_storage() == split_format ||
298	    user_storage() == interleaved_format));
299    user_data_.rebind(pointer);
300    storage_.deallocate(map_.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size());
301    layout_ = applied_layout_type(dom);
302    storage_.rebind(map_.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size(),
303		    user_data_.as_storage(complex_type()));
304  }
305  void rebind(uT *real_pointer, uT *imag_pointer, Domain<D> const &dom)
306  {
307    assert(!admitted() &&
308	   (user_storage() == split_format ||
309	    user_storage() == interleaved_format));
310    user_data_.rebind(real_pointer, imag_pointer);
311    storage_.deallocate(map_.impl_pool(), layout_.total_size());
312    layout_ = applied_layout_type(dom);
313    storage_.rebind(map_.impl_pool(),
314		    layout_.total_size(),
315		    user_data_.as_storage(complex_type()));
316  }
317
318  void find(T *&pointer) VSIP_NOTHROW
319  {
320    assert(user_storage() == no_user_format ||
321	   user_storage() == array_format);
322    user_data_.find(pointer);
323  }
324  void find(uT *&pointer) VSIP_NOTHROW
325  {
326    assert(user_storage() == no_user_format ||
327	   user_storage() == interleaved_format);
328    user_data_.find(pointer);
329  }
330  void find(uT *&real_pointer, uT*& imag_pointer) VSIP_NOTHROW
331  {
332    assert(user_storage() == no_user_format ||
333	   user_storage() == split_format);
334    user_data_.find(real_pointer, imag_pointer);
335  }
336
337  void admit(bool update = true) VSIP_NOTHROW
338  {
339    if (!admitted_ && storage_.is_alloc() && update)
340    {
341      using namespace vsip::impl::profile;
342      event<memory>("admit", size() * sizeof(value_type));
343      for (index_type i = 0; i < size(); ++i)
344	storage_.put(i, user_data_.get(i));
345    }
346    admitted_ = true;
347  }
348  /// Release user-storage from VSIPL++ control to user control.
349  ///
350  /// Note:
351  ///  - It is not an error to release a block multiple times,
352  ///    but it may signify an application programming error.
353  void release(bool update = true) VSIP_NOTHROW
354  {
355    if (user_data_.format() == no_user_format)
356      return;
357    if (admitted_ && storage_.is_alloc() && update)
358    {
359      using namespace vsip::impl::profile;
360      event<memory>("release", size() * sizeof(value_type));
361      for (index_type i = 0; i < size(); ++i)
362	this->user_data_.put(i, storage_.get(i));
363    }
364    admitted_ = false;
365  }
366
367  /// Release user-storage and return pointer (array format).
368  ///
369  /// Requires:
370  ///   THIS to be a block with either array_format user storage,
371  ///      or no_user_format user storage.
372  void release(bool update, T*& pointer) VSIP_NOTHROW
373  {
374    assert(user_storage() == no_user_format ||
375	   user_storage() == array_format);
376    release(update);
377    user_data_.find(pointer);
378  }
379
380  /// Release user-storeage and return pointer (interleaved format).
381  ///
382  /// Requires:
383  ///   THIS to be a block with either interleaved_format user storage,
384  ///      or no_user_format user storage.
385  void release(bool update, uT*& pointer) VSIP_NOTHROW
386  {
387    assert(user_storage() == no_user_format ||
388	   user_storage() == interleaved_format);
389    release(update);
390    user_data_.find(pointer);
391  }
392
393  /// Release user-storeage and return pointers (split format).
394  ///
395  /// Requires:
396  ///   THIS to be a block with either split_format user storage,
397  ///      or no_user_format user storage.
398  void release(bool update, uT*& real_pointer, uT*& imag_pointer) VSIP_NOTHROW
399  {
400    assert(user_storage() == no_user_format ||
401	   user_storage() == split_format);
402    release(update);
403    user_data_.find(real_pointer, imag_pointer);
404  }
405
406  user_storage_type user_storage() const VSIP_NOTHROW
407  { return user_data_.format();}
408  bool admitted() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return admitted_;}
409
410  map_type const &map() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return map_;}
411
412  length_type size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
413  {
414    length_type retval = layout_.size(0);
415    for (dimension_type d = 1; d < D; ++d)
416      retval *= layout_.size(d);
417    return retval;
418  }
419
420  length_type size(dimension_type block_dim, dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
421  {
422    assert((block_dim == 1 || block_dim == D) && (d < block_dim));
423
424    if (block_dim == 1) return size();
425    else return layout_.size(d);
426  }
427
428  value_type get(index_type idx) const VSIP_NOTHROW
429  {
430    assert(idx < size());
431    return storage_.get(idx);
432  }
433  value_type get(index_type idx0, index_type idx1) const VSIP_NOTHROW
434  {
435    assert(idx0 < layout_.size(0) && idx1 < layout_.size(1));
436    return storage_.get(layout_.index(idx0, idx1));
437  }
438  value_type get(index_type idx0, index_type idx1, index_type idx2) const VSIP_NOTHROW
439  {
440    assert(idx0 < layout_.size(0) && idx1 < layout_.size(1) &&
441	   idx2 < layout_.size(2));
442    return storage_.get(layout_.index(idx0, idx1, idx2));
443  }
444
445  void put(index_type idx, T val) VSIP_NOTHROW
446  {
447    assert(idx < size());
448    storage_.put(idx, val);
449  }
450  void put(index_type idx0, index_type idx1, T val) VSIP_NOTHROW
451  {
452    assert(idx0 < layout_.size(0) && idx1 < layout_.size(1));
453    storage_.put(layout_.index(idx0, idx1), val);
454  }
455  void put(index_type idx0, index_type idx1, index_type idx2, T val)
456    VSIP_NOTHROW
457  {
458    assert(idx0 < layout_.size(0) && idx1 < layout_.size(1) &&
459	   idx2 < layout_.size(2));
460    storage_.put(layout_.index(idx0, idx1, idx2), val);
461  }
462
463  reference_type impl_ref(index_type idx) VSIP_NOTHROW
464  {
465    assert(idx < size());
466    return storage_.ref(idx);
467  }
468  const_reference_type impl_ref(index_type idx) const VSIP_NOTHROW
469  {
470    assert(idx < size());
471    return storage_.ref(idx);
472  }
473  reference_type impl_ref(Index<dim> const &idx) VSIP_NOTHROW
474  {
475    return storage_.ref(layout_.index(idx));
476  }
477  const_reference_type impl_ref(Index<dim> const &idx) const VSIP_NOTHROW
478  {
479    return storage_.ref(layout_.index(idx));
480  }
481
482  data_type impl_data() { return storage_.data();}
483  const_data_type impl_data() const { return storage_.data();}
484  stride_type impl_stride(dimension_type block_dim, dimension_type d) const
485  {
486    assert(block_dim == 1 || block_dim == D);
487    assert(d < D);
488    if (block_dim == 1) return 1;
489    else return layout_.stride(d);
490  }
491
492private:
493  applied_layout_type layout_;
494  User_storage<T> user_data_;
495  storage_type storage_;
496  map_type map_;
497  bool admitted_;
498};
499
500} // namespace vsip::impl
501} // namespace vsip
